admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan Project
            (SAL) will pursue three broad objectives: stabilization;
            structural reform towards the strengthening of a market
            economy to improve resource allocation and restore
            sustainable growth; and the construction of a more adequate
            social safety net to mitigate the effects of the economic
            reforms on the poor. It emphasizes the structural reforms
            needed to improve resource allocation and growth. In
            addition to supporting an adequate medium-term macroeconomic
            framework and financing plan, it supports the initiation of
            reforms in the public sector, including privatization. It
            also supports the Government's resolve to reduce
            distortion in both prices and the overall incentive
            environment, to be pursued through the liberalization of
            price, trade, production and investment controls.
